commit_message:
dhcpv6-relay - CentOS Stream 9

Change the default dhcp_relay_image to CentOS Stream 9.

Stop using os-net-config, and instead rely on cloud-init
for network configuration. Even with dhcp disabled on
the provisioning network cloud-init correctly configures
the interfaces.

Add --conf-file=/dev/null to ensure no unwanted loading
of config from the dnsmasq default config file path.

The OpenStack stein release repositories are no longer
used since there is no CentOS 9 Stream build. The Openstack
packages was only required for os-net-config.

With this change CentOS 7 is no longer supported as OS for
the dhcpv6-relay instance.

Also add "Configuration for Routed Networks IPv6" to
sample env generator.

Change-Id: I446804d3ff90ea52b43b996e36ec876e8262eae4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-virtual-baremetal refs/changes/39/857539/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: default: CentOS-Stream-GenericCloud-9 The base image for the dhcrelay instance. CentOS Stream 9 image is currently the only one supported. ExecStart=/usr/sbin/dnsmasq --conf-file=/dev/null --keep-in-foreground --port 0 --dhcp-relay=$provision2_ip,ff05::1:3,eth1 --dhcp-relay=$provision3_ip,ff05::1:3,eth1
deleted_lines: default: CentOS-7-x86_64-GenericCloud The base image for the dhcrelay instance. A CentOS 7 image is currently the only one supported. - centos-release-openstack-stein - path: /etc/os-net-config/config.yaml content: str_replace: template: | network_config: - type: interface name: eth0 use_dhcp: false use_dhcpv6: false addresses: - ip_netmask: $private_ip_netmask routes: - default: true next_hop: $private_gateway - type: interface name: eth1 use_dhcp: false use_dhcpv6: false addresses: - ip_netmask: $provision_ip_netmask - type: interface name: eth2 use_dhcp: false use_dhcpv6: false addresses: - ip_netmask: $provision2_ip_netmask - type: interface name: eth3 use_dhcp: false use_dhcpv6: false addresses: - ip_netmask: $provision3_ip_netmask params: $private_gateway: {get_attr: [dhcp_relay_port_private, subnets, 0, gateway_ip]} $private_ip_netmask: list_join: - / - - {get_attr: [dhcp_relay_port_private, fixed_ips, 0, ip_address]} - {str_split: ['/', {get_attr: [dhcp_relay_port_private, subnets, 0, cidr]}, 1]} $provision_ip_netmask: {get_param: [provision_network_routers_data, provision_router_cidr]} $provision2_ip_netmask: {get_param: [provision_network_routers_data, provision2_router_cidr]} $provision3_ip_netmask: {get_param: [provision_network_routers_data, provision3_router_cidr]} ExecStart=/usr/sbin/dnsmasq --keep-in-foreground --port 0 --dhcp-relay=$provision2_ip,ff05::1:3,eth1 --dhcp-relay=$provision3_ip,ff05::1:3,eth1 - ['yum', '-y', 'install', 'os-net-config'] - ['os-net-config', '--config', '/etc/os-net-config/config.yaml']

commit_message:
Drop DeployedServer resources

We replace the 'deploy_server_id' of TripleOSoftwareDeployment
resources with the actual server_id during config download.
We can manage without creating these DeployedServer resources,
as we don't expect these resources to be SIGNALED.

Change-Id: Ib95a51f0c57943cf6127640b829c042a14d1dcf9

deleted_lines: server: {get_resource: TripleOServer} TripleOServer: type: OS::Heat::DeployedServer properties: name: server_resource software_config_transport: POLL_SERVER_HEAT

commit_message:
Enable post-copy by setting unprivileged_userfaultfd

The setting vm.unprivileged_userfaultfd = 1 is required to make
post-copy working for containerised libvirt.

Make this setting configured for OS version 9 only, as version 8 does
not have such an option.

Related: rhbz#2122172
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I277af6db375c0d018cc87c34ebbdab6cdca2ff0a

commit_message:
Ensure container's image get updated if their name stay the same.

In some environment the containers' tag isn't modified (think
"latest"). This is already supported during deployment so we re-use
the code during update.

We also make sure that the same mechanism is available for
ovn_controller update. It can be selectively disable if one pass:

    --skip-tags ovn_image

to the external-update run command.

We remove the ignore error as it's wrong indication that we are not
taking errors into account in those tasks. We also adjust the
delay as it's 3 seconds by default making the time we check longer
than the async tasks. Eventually, we add a new parameter for
controlling the downloading of the image
"OVNControllerImageUpdateTimeout" which is set to 10min by default.

Backport conflicts:
- Testing ci is different and we don't need that part of the patch;
- podman_image instead of full containers.podman.podman_image as this
  isn't supported in train (module not found)
- Some code from wallaby aren't backported, so by default code
  conflict occured: one of them is the excluded_overcloud code that will
  find its way later in train.

Change-Id: I6d439367816d5f5968b8f890f74b7a2f74715f52
(cherry picked from commit 76dec8bc6ad9a07ffc497a050330931d5e38dfcf)

service is present and supports the v3 API. No need to duplicate this.

Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <stephenfin@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Add information about subunit index in logstash role

With the commit [1], the logsender would push the tempest subunit
results to the Opensearch, but to the new index: 'subunit'.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ci-log-processing/+/858373

commit_message:
Set LANG environment variable

The logsender tool on parsing the subunit file, it was raising
an error:

  can't decode byte 0xb3 in position 0

By adding proper LANG, problem disappear.

Change-Id: I718c642c7f7452345f8703b1eeb69ef421ed56c6

subject: Avoid LB ERROR status on delete when LS/LR are already deleted
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-28 07:55:30.000000000', 'files': ['ovn_octavia_provider/helper.py', 'ovn_octavia_provider/tests/unit/test_helper.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider/commit/465a895f0da9b42a6edb0ac2836941049751e2d9', 'message': 'Avoid LB ERROR status on delete when LS/LR are already deleted

The delete operation of an LB lists all references to it (LS and
LR) and in a single transaction deletes them together with the
LB itself. If any of those deletions raise a RowNotFound exception,
the execution will report ERROR status.

This patch will reduce those situations, rechecking the command
that triggers the RowNotFound exception and passing in case a LS
or a LR was the culprit, deleting finally the LB and reporting as
a DELETED status. In other case, the exception is raised and
finally the LB will be reported as ERROR status.

Closes-Bug:#1990129

Change-Id: I91b29add2a5d2ca3d4eff4b8d6a88be16c42be51
(cherry picked from commit f9ccb4c48627a200ef27dde60b01bccdccac4e45)
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid LB ERROR status on delete when LS/LR are already deleted

The delete operation of an LB lists all references to it (LS and
LR) and in a single transaction deletes them together with the
LB itself. If any of those deletions raise a RowNotFound exception,
the execution will report ERROR status.

This patch will reduce those situations, rechecking the command
that triggers the RowNotFound exception and passing in case a LS
or a LR was the culprit, deleting finally the LB and reporting as
a DELETED status. In other case, the exception is raised and
finally the LB will be reported as ERROR status.

Closes-Bug:#1990129

Change-Id: I91b29add2a5d2ca3d4eff4b8d6a88be16c42be51
(cherry picked from commit f9ccb4c48627a200ef27dde60b01bccdccac4e45)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider refs/changes/27/859527/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @mock.patch.object(ovn_helper.OvnProviderHelper, 'delete_vip_port') def test_lb_delete_step_by_step(self, del_port): self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lr_lb_del.side_effect = [idlutils.RowNotFound] status = self.helper.lb_delete(self.lb) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['provisioning_status'], constants.DELETED) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['operating_status'], constants.OFFLINE) self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lb_del.assert_called_once_with( self.ovn_lb.uuid) del_port.assert_called_once_with('foo_port') @mock.patch.object(ovn_helper.OvnProviderHelper, 'delete_vip_port') def test_lb_delete_step_by_step_exception(self, del_port): self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lb_del.side_effect = [idlutils.RowNotFound] status = self.helper.lb_delete(self.lb) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['provisioning_status'], constants.ERROR) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['operating_status'], constants.ERROR) self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lb_del.assert_called_once_with( self.ovn_lb.uuid) del_port.assert_not_called()

commit_message:
Add Rocky to default distro map and use published images

This patch also changes python version and default tag for centos.
prometheus-efk and venus jobs commented out, elasticsearch images
are unbuildable
cells is commented out because proxysql is unbuildable

Change-Id: Ic358f8b600317d3c2fc45130a59785225aea1153

commit_message:
image: Add metadef schema resource to v2 api

* Add resource for (Glance) Metadata Definition Schema API
  (https://docs.openstack.org/api-ref/image/v2/metadefs-index.html?expanded=#metadata-definition-schemas)
* Adjust names to avoid abbreviations
* Adjust grouping
* Add tests
* Add docs and release note
* Trim underlines in docs
* Resolve merge conflict
* Seperate functional test to another file
* Rename test class name correctly

Change-Id: If2dfbca5ffbd425e4183b310af9534411318a395

subject: Fix bug for linuxscsi
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2021-04-30 09:47:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/27bdece8cd726151b26dd338f31a78cc0c54b771', 'message': 'Fix bug for linuxscsi

Signed-off-by: chenglei1 <chenglei1_yewu@cmss.chinamobile.com>
Change-Id: I8bce0b4b5f05b601dfabcb5b9e6b265815add2c3
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2021-05-13 12:06:24.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/initiator/linuxscsi.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/os-brick/commit/307f01554859c4aa54b5681c500cc4cbf1c8fff3', 'message': 'Fix bug for linuxscsi

The general usage of the command is as follows:
command: /lib/udev/scsi_id --page 0x83 --whitelisted --device=[path],
--device is an optional parameter.

However, "ProcessExecutionError: unexpected error while running command"
without '--device=' will appear in some operating systems. Although
there are few cases, it needs to be considered. It is recommended to
add optional parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1928331
Change-Id: I8bce0b4b5f05b601dfabcb5b9e6b265815add2c3
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bug for linuxscsi

The general usage of the command is as follows:
command: /lib/udev/scsi_id --page 0x83 --whitelisted --device=[path],
--device is an optional parameter.

However, "ProcessExecutionError: unexpected error while running command"
without '--device=' will appear in some operating systems. Although
there are few cases, it needs to be considered. It is recommended to
add optional parameters.

Closes-Bug: #1928331
Change-Id: I8bce0b4b5f05b601dfabcb5b9e6b265815add2c3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/os-brick refs/changes/11/788911/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if '--device=' not in path: path = '--device=' + path

commit_message:
Revert "Enable post-copy by setting unprivileged_userfaultfd"

This reverts commit c43d69c5d8a1be9c9e2069fd84a8c205b2eeb39a.

Reason for revert:
We need this fix in stable/wallaby but this change can't be backported
because it is not compatible with CentOS 8. To make the solution
consistent between wallaby and master, we revert this and redo fixing
the problem in a different approach.

Change-Id: I07dc3888c28cb557d2fcd8f723354a47c785224f

subject: Limit bandwidth during postcopy migration.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-09-26 04:03:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/migration.py', 'nova/conf/libvirt.py', 'nova/tests/fixtures/libvirt.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/guest.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/cadcd87f525820a32a96e860e9189b0d2f31a58f', 'message': 'Limit bandwidth during postcopy migration.

This patch add new option live_migration_postcopy_bandwidth to limit
bandwidth during postcopy mode, the default value is 0, mean no limit.

Closes-Bug: 1990802
Change-Id: I7449351eabb2ed475a3fa263cf5a017f2f689e4f
'}]
commit_message:
Limit bandwidth during postcopy migration.

This patch add new option live_migration_postcopy_bandwidth to limit
bandwidth during postcopy mode, the default value is 0, mean no limit.

Closes-Bug: 1990802
Change-Id: I7449351eabb2ed475a3fa263cf5a017f2f689e4f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/07/859207/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def migrate_configure_postcopy_bandwidth(self, bandwidth): """Configure maximum bandwidth for postcopy migration :param bandwidth: Bandwidth in MB/s """ self._domain.migrateSetMaxSpeed(bandwidth, libvirt.VIR_DOMAIN_MIGRATE_MAX_SPEED_POSTCOPY)

Backport support for access rules

This patch is a charm-helpers sync to get the fixes
application credential access-rules.

Change-Id: I0cc2b9df1837d7f05f20eaa0f153a76550e40148
Related-Bug: #1965967

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: Idf4a6cd1e0888576f890b00aa5b343936900d6dd

commit_message:
Add Kinetic and Zed support

* sync charm-helpers to classic charms
* change openstack-origin/source default to zed
* align testing with zed
* add new zed bundles
* add zed bundles to tests.yaml
* add zed tests to osci.yaml and .zuul.yaml
* update build-on and run-on bases
* add bindep.txt for py310
* sync tox.ini and requirements.txt for ruamel
* use charmcraft_channel 2.0/stable
* drop reactive plugin overrides
* move interface/layer env vars to charmcraft.yaml

Change-Id: I4cae0a313230a8617beac36a2dbfe0c019c5e0de

commit_message:
Build separately for each supported series and use binary builds

Charms for OpenStack Yoga supports both Ubuntu Focal and Jammy
which means Python 3.8 and Python 3.10.  Managing dependencies
across those two versions is non-trivial and we need to build
the charm on the series the charm is supposed to support.

Switch to using a binary build which allows pip's dependency
resolution to work.

Change-Id: I1bf4aac08cf7388fec4550d40887a8df45927589

commit_message:
Build separately for each supported series and use binary builds

Charms for OpenStack Yoga supports both Ubuntu Focal and Jammy
which means Python 3.8 and Python 3.10.  Managing dependencies
across those two versions is non-trivial and we need to build
the charm on the series the charm is supposed to support.

Switch to using a binary build which allows pip's dependency
resolution to work.

This patch also drops the impish bundle and other unused
overlays.

Change-Id: Idf869038e65088ce59cabb907626bb014a591bef

commit_message:
Use openstacksdk<0.99.0 and a-c-o<2.0.0 on bifrost-*collections-* jobs

The latest release 1.9.1 of Ansible OpenStack Collection [1] is
compatible only to openstacksdk <0.99.0. Until the former has been
fixed, a workaround [2] is required in Bifrost to pin both the
Ansible OpenStack Collection as well as openstacksdk.

These pinned versions will be overwritten when their repositories
are listed in job.required-projects in .zuul.yaml, which we do in
the master branch of Ansible OpenStack collection [3] for both jobs
bifrost-collections-src and bifrost-keystone-collections-src.

This has two side effects: First, Bifrost's CI jobs use the master
branch of both openstacksdk and Ansible OpenStack Collection for
both bifrost-*collections-* jobs which thus differ from other
Bifrost jobs that use pinned releases.
Second, it causes a chicken-and-egg problem: Applying a breaking
change to module openstack.cloud.baremetal_node [4] will break
Bifrost but could easily be fixed [5]. The fix would be backward
compatible to previous releases of Ansible OpenStack Collection
and openstacksdk. But merging that fix [5] without patching
module openstack.cloud.baremetal_port [6] first would break the
bifrost-*collections-* jobs. The patch for openstack.cloud.\
baremetal_port [6] would break bifrost-*collections-* jobs
without the Bifrost fix [5].

The solution is to use the last known working releases of
Ansible OpenStack collection and openstacksdk in both
bifrost-*collections-* jobs like all other Bifrost jobs already
do.

Once we release Ansible OpenStack collection 2.0.0, we simply
have to revert Dmitry's workaround [2] and this patch.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack
[2] https://opendev.org/openstack/bifrost/commit/03ddd026567f7b61b89d83b0e7e7cb35ed466ae6
[3] https://opendev.org/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack/src/commit/41f3007a80ea4410bc7a91ed616276d654a8a97f/.zuul.yaml#L286
[4] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ansible-collections-openstack/+/854113
[5] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/bifrost/+/859430/

Change-Id: I1bb2fc8057e769dafdbeb10b4874591c03c89d1e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bifrost refs/changes/84/859984/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # FIXME(dtantsur): downgrade ansible-collections-openstack # and openstacksdk because the former has not been ported # yet to openstacksdk >=0.99.0 required-projects: &bifrost_collections_required_projects - name: openstack/ansible-collections-openstack override-checkout: stable/1.0.0 - name: openstack/openstacksdk override-checkout: stable/yoga # FIXME(dtantsur): downgrade ansible-collections-openstack # and openstacksdk because the former has not been ported # yet to openstacksdk >=0.99.0 required-projects: *bifrost_collections_required_projects

commit_message:
bnr - Update on rear scripts to support the ceph bnr on LVM

Due to the inclusion of lvm and the creation of different logical volumes, the backup and restore scripts for the /var/lib/ceph folder need to be adapted. It is required to change the directory path.
Closes-Bug: rhbz#2118397 - https://bugzilla.redhat.com/2118397
Change-Id: I5ad1f2c968be5087b71d7db2626ea96fe4959b25
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/20/858520/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [ -d "lib/ceph" ] && tar cvfz /tmp/ceph.tar.gz lib/ceph --xattrs --xattrs-include='*.*' --acls rm -rf /mnt/local/lib/ceph/* tar xvC /mnt/local -f /tmp/ceph.tar.gz lib/ceph --xattrs --xattrs-include='*.*'
deleted_lines: [ -d "var/lib/ceph" ] && tar cvfz /tmp/ceph.tar.gz var/lib/ceph --xattrs --xattrs-include='*.*' --acls rm -rf /mnt/local/var/lib/ceph/* tar xvC /mnt/local -f /tmp/ceph.tar.gz var/lib/ceph --xattrs --xattrs-include='*.*'

commit_message:
Avoid LB ERROR status on delete when LS/LR are already deleted

The delete operation of an LB lists all references to it (LS and
LR) and in a single transaction deletes them together with the
LB itself. If any of those deletions raise a RowNotFound exception,
the execution will report ERROR status.

This patch will reduce those situations, rechecking the command
that triggers the RowNotFound exception and passing in case a LS
or a LR was the culprit, deleting finally the LB and reporting as
a DELETED status. In other case, the exception is raised and
finally the LB will be reported as ERROR status.

Closes-Bug:#1990129

Change-Id: I91b29add2a5d2ca3d4eff4b8d6a88be16c42be51
(cherry picked from commit f9ccb4c48627a200ef27dde60b01bccdccac4e45)

added_lines: @mock.patch.object(ovn_helper.OvnProviderHelper, 'delete_vip_port') def test_lb_delete_step_by_step(self, del_port): self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lr_lb_del.side_effect = [idlutils.RowNotFound] status = self.helper.lb_delete(self.lb) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['provisioning_status'], constants.DELETED) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['operating_status'], constants.OFFLINE) self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lb_del.assert_called_once_with( self.ovn_lb.uuid) del_port.assert_called_once_with('foo_port') @mock.patch.object(ovn_helper.OvnProviderHelper, 'delete_vip_port') def test_lb_delete_step_by_step_exception(self, del_port): self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lb_del.side_effect = [idlutils.RowNotFound] status = self.helper.lb_delete(self.lb) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['provisioning_status'], constants.ERROR) self.assertEqual(status['loadbalancers'][0]['operating_status'], constants.ERROR) self.helper.ovn_nbdb_api.lb_del.assert_called_once_with( self.ovn_lb.uuid) del_port.assert_not_called()

Latest versions of podman have dropped the AUDIT_WRITE capability from
the default list. This creates a regression in our container, showing an
error log whenever `sudo' is called, and misleading operators, devs and
users regarding the actual root cause of their issue.

Re-allowing the AUDIT_WRITE will remove those red-herring, while
ensuring a consistent log content, especially for containers running
without root user.

This patch takes advantage of the /etc/containers/containers.conf.d
directory, and creates per-section files in there.

Note that, when you're passing a list of value, it will be correctly
written as a coma separated list, within square brackets. This is
the expetected output (TOML).

Please also note that we have to set the full capability list, since the
file format (TOML) isn't really convenient for edition via ansible -
there's no plugin for that, and we can't easily take the existing
capabilities (there's an "ini" lookup, but since it's a lookup(), it's
local to the ansible controller, so we can't really rely on it. And it's
not an INI file anyway).

Please also note that AUDIT_WRITE doesn't allow *read*, which is another
capability, nor *control*, which is yet another one[1]. There's
therefore not that many issues re-adding this capability.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/capabilities.7.html

Closes-Bug: #1991219
Change-Id: I420dcddad9298933775242eaeea4b5ad5fc8e9ce

local to the ansible controller, so we can't really rely on it. And it's
not an INI file anyway).

commit_message:
Re-add AUDIT_WRITE capability to containers

Latest versions of podman have dropped the AUDIT_WRITE capability from
the default list. This creates a regression in our container, showing an
error log whenever `sudo' is called, and misleading operators, devs and
users regarding the actual root cause of their issue.

Re-allowing the AUDIT_WRITE will remove those red-herring, while
ensuring a consistent log content, especially for containers running
without root user.

This patch takes advantage of the /etc/containers/containers.conf.d
directory, and creates per-section files in there.

Note that, when you're passing a list of value, it will be correctly
written as a coma separated list, within square brackets. This is
the expetected output (TOML).

Please also note that we have to set the full capability list, since the
file format (TOML) isn't really convenient for edition via ansible -
there's no plugin for that, and we can't easily take the existing
capabilities (there's an "ini" lookup, but since it's a lookup(), it's
local to the ansible controller, so we can't really rely on it. And it's
not an INI file anyway).

Please also note that AUDIT_WRITE doesn't allow *read*, which is another
capability, nor *control*, which is yet another one[1]. There's
therefore not that many issues re-adding this capability.

[1] https://man7.org/linux/man-pages/man7/capabilities.7.html

Closes-Bug: #1991219
Change-Id: I420dcddad9298933775242eaeea4b5ad5fc8e9ce
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-ansible refs/changes/89/859289/7 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # WRITE_AUDIT was removed from the default capabilities, but is # needed in order to log sudo calls from within containers. default['cap_add'] = ['AUDIT_WRITE']

commit_message:
Avoid LB ERROR status on delete when LS/LR are already deleted

The delete operation of an LB lists all references to it (LS and
LR) and in a single transaction deletes them together with the
LB itself. If any of those deletions raise a RowNotFound exception,
the execution will report ERROR status.

This patch will reduce those situations, rechecking the command
that triggers the RowNotFound exception and passing in case a LS
or a LR was the culprit, deleting finally the LB and reporting as
a DELETED status. In other case, the exception is raised and
finally the LB will be reported as ERROR status.

Closes-Bug:#1990129

Change-Id: I91b29add2a5d2ca3d4eff4b8d6a88be16c42be51

commit_message:
Avoid LB ERROR status on delete when LS/LR are already deleted

The delete operation of an LB lists all references to it (LS and
LR) and in a single transaction deletes them together with the
LB itself. If any of those deletions raise a RowNotFound exception,
the execution will report ERROR status.

This patch will reduce those situations, rechecking the command
that triggers the RowNotFound exception and passing in case a LS
or a LR was the culprit, deleting finally the LB and reporting as
a DELETED status. In other case, the exception is raised and
finally the LB will be reported as ERROR status.

Closes-Bug:#1990129

Change-Id: I91b29add2a5d2ca3d4eff4b8d6a88be16c42be51
(cherry picked from commit f9ccb4c48627a200ef27dde60b01bccdccac4e45)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider refs/changes/31/859531/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Avoid LB ERROR status on delete when LS/LR are already deleted

The delete operation of an LB lists all references to it (LS and
LR) and in a single transaction deletes them together with the
LB itself. If any of those deletions raise a RowNotFound exception,
the execution will report ERROR status.

This patch will reduce those situations, rechecking the command
that triggers the RowNotFound exception and passing in case a LS
or a LR was the culprit, deleting finally the LB and reporting as
a DELETED status. In other case, the exception is raised and
finally the LB will be reported as ERROR status.

Closes-Bug:#1990129

Change-Id: I91b29add2a5d2ca3d4eff4b8d6a88be16c42be51
(cherry picked from commit f9ccb4c48627a200ef27dde60b01bccdccac4e45)

commit_message:
Support scraping of subunit files from tripleo jobs

The testrepository.subunit files from tripleo jobs are located in logs/
folder. This is a different location than it is currently expected by
logscraper.

This patch makes sure that we download the testrepository.subunit file
from tripleo by adding the logs/testrepository.subunit to
download-list.yaml.sample.

Change-Id: I956c34809596980070ef98a2fe7e3f5949c4ae62
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ci-log-processing refs/changes/05/859405/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - name: logs/testrepository.subunit tags: - tripleo

commit_message:
Use host network for db_sync

Let's use host network for all containers doing db_sync.
This would avoid any issues from the netavark network
stack which is the default with podman.

Resolves: rhbz#2123252
Change-Id: Ifc72293052e8719cd519400c76c548910a741ff3
(cherry picked from commit a197198b7c967776b9aad8983ffb0ac54bca6eda)

commit_message:
Adds check if blk_dev_info has correct flavor.swap

Added user requested flavor swap info in block_device_info, if
its not already present in block_device_info while finishing
resize

Closes-Bug: #1552777
Change-Id: I5d9feed219964cf0c72428b4cce70b00d75303ae

commit_message:
Adds check if blk_dev_info has correct flavor.swap

Added user requested flavor swap info in block_device_info, if
its not already present in block_device_info while finishing
resize

added_lines: # NOTE(auniyal): block_device_info will be used to set all disk # properties for instance, if its not set as user requested # at this place, it will update the wrong value later in instance xml. # # This is specifically needed if user requested to shrink swap to 0 # refrence bug 1552777 if type(block_device_info) is dict \ and block_device_info.get('swap'): if block_device_info['swap']['swap_size'] \ != instance.new_flavor.swap: block_device_info['swap']['swap_size'] \ = instance.new_flavor.swap

commit_message:
Ceilometer: Ensure the ResellerAdmin role exists

This is follow-up of e9c9478f3afbcee9c5abdfa6dcff302aca5b76f5 and
ensures the ResellerAdmin role exists, to avoid deployment failure in
case both swift and rados gateway are disabled.

Also associate the ResellerAdmin role and ceilometer user

Change-Id: I25ee72591b3410328d7b7d15839e84cad4b4e45e
(cherry picked from commit 87622c6dec0fda7d6b6c96a1e9d019bc56e98595)
(cherry picked from commit 028375f488c79c14c2cd119975b7189ca978f967)

commit_message:
Accept a port deletion with missing port binding information

If the database "port" child register "ml2_port_bindings" has been
manually deleted from the database, now is possible to delete the
Neutron Port resource (that implies the "port" database register and
all other child registers)

Before this patch, the port deletion CLI command succeeded (no exception
was raised) but the Port resource was not deleted.

Closes-Bug: #1988323
Change-Id: I02de276d0cd8e4ae27355d4aee5f48e92634f318

subject: Allow configuration of slow query log extended statistics
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2022-08-29 12:54:42.000000000', 'files': ['templates/my.cnf.j2', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server/commit/34c099582ef088e7dcaf8ba93fe0738415261f33', 'message': 'Allow configuration of slow query log extended statistics

MariaDB does provide much more than just "slow" queries via its slow log, see
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/slow-query-log-extended-statistics/ for details.

This adds three optional variables to enable configuration of this feature:
 * galera_log_slow_verbosity
 * galera_log_slow_filter
 * galera_log_slow_rate_limit

Change-Id: Ib1a7bd24ef1dfa1d6bfafd5ba0eb91129aa2cf6a

commit_message:
Allow configuration of slow query log extended statistics

MariaDB does provide much more than just "slow" queries via its slow log, see
https://mariadb.com/kb/en/slow-query-log-extended-statistics/ for details.

This adds three optional variables to enable configuration of this feature:
 * galera_log_slow_verbosity
 * galera_log_slow_filter
 * galera_log_slow_rate_limit

Change-Id: Ib1a7bd24ef1dfa1d6bfafd5ba0eb91129aa2cf6a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-galera_server refs/changes/20/855020/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Now that nodes are all pre-provisioned by the baremetal

commit_message:
Remove unused client handling

Now that nodes are all pre-provisioned by the baremetal
provisioning process. We no longer need to initialise
Nova and Ironic clients in DeployOvercloud.

These clients are initialised during the playbook execution
even if you want to do the provisioning process during the
overcloud deployment. Initialising here is unnecessary now.

Change-Id: I6eb2a9afec1faed0b670096d246942debf311382

commit_message:
Associate the ResellerAdmin role and ceilometer user

'ResellerAdmin' operator role allows 'ceilometer' user to access
objects from all swift accounts(AUTH_*).

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/857866
Closes-Bug: #1987273

Signed-off-by: Yadnesh Kulkarni <ykulkarn@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I5e0a0770726ade5208bc1945a1e8ae42fd185494
(cherry picked from commit e9c9478f3afbcee9c5abdfa6dcff302aca5b76f5)

commit_message:
Deprecate option for old api_export_size bug

This change deprecates the option to workaround the old bug. The bug
was fixed during Newton cycle and is fixed in all versions currently
maintained.

Related-Bug: #1573141
